metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11023 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
The agroot() function in cgraph\obj.c in libcgraph.a in Graphviz2.39.20160612.1140 has a NULL pointer dereference, as demonstrated bygraphml2gv.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11023` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphviz - 2.42.2-3build2
libcdt5 - 2.42.2-3build2
libcgraph6 - 2.42.2-3build2
libgv-guile - 2.42.2-3build2
libgv-lua - 2.42.2-3build2
libgv-perl - 2.42.2-3build2
libgv-php7 - 2.42.2-3build2
libgv-ruby - 2.42.2-3build2
libgv-tcl - 2.42.2-3build2
libgvc6 - 2.42.2-3build2
libgvc6-plugins-gtk - 2.42.2-3build2
libgvpr2 - 2.42.2-3build2
liblab-gamut1 - 2.42.2-3build2
libpathplan4 - 2.42.2-3build2
libxdot4 - 2.42.2-3build2
python3-gv - 2.42.2-3build2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphviz package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.42.2-3build2').
